It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a short lifespan, blooming only once before dying. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, Coppensia cipoensis is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
